function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Lack of optimization for the entire protocol from sampling to detection/quantification may lead to inaccurate results and inefficient virus analysis.","Impact":"Inaccurate virus analysis and inefficient detection/quantification could result in misinformed public health decisions and inadequate containment measures for contagious diseases.","Mitigation":"Develop and validate methodological protocols for the quantitative analysis of the virus in WBE. Optimize the entire protocol including sampling, sample storage, concentration, RNA extraction, and detection/quantification.","Technologies":"Methodological protocols, optimization techniques for sampling and detection, advanced RNA detection methods like CRISPR and dPCR.","People":"Research and laboratory personnel involved in virus analysis, public health officials, and policymakers.","Owner":"Research and laboratory personnel, public health organizations, and policymakers"},{"Description":"Significant issues identified for the virus quantitative analysis in wastewater and sludge matrices, indicating potential challenges in accurate virus detection and quantification in these complex environments.","Impact":"Challenges in accurate virus detection and quantification in wastewater and sludge could lead to misinterpretation of public health risks and inefficiencies in implementing appropriate containment measures.","Mitigation":"Focus on developing and validating effective methodological protocols specifically for virus quantitative analysis in complex wastewater and sludge matrices.","Technologies":"Advanced RNA detection methods like CRISPR and dPCR, methodological protocols, optimization techniques for complex sample matrices.","People":"Research and laboratory personnel specializing in environmental virology, public health officials, and policymakers addressing wastewater management.","Owner":"Research and laboratory personnel, public health organizations, and policymakers"},{"Description":"Utilization of advanced RNA detection methods like CRISPR and dPCR for virus detection and quantification presents the risk of misinterpretation or inadequate understanding of the results compared to traditional methods like RT-qPCR.","Impact":"Misinterpretation or inadequate understanding of results from advanced RNA detection methods could lead to incorrect public health decisions and inappropriate containment measures for contagious diseases.","Mitigation":"Provide training and education on the proper interpretation and understanding of results from advanced RNA detection methods. Validate and compare results with traditional methods to ensure accuracy and reliability.","Technologies":"Training and educational resources, validation and comparison studies with traditional methods, advanced RNA detection methods like CRISPR and dPCR.","People":"Research and laboratory personnel, public health officials, policymakers, and healthcare professionals.","Owner":"Research and laboratory personnel, public health organizations, and educational institutions."}]}
